programmes.show_description: What do the Goggleboxers think of Black Mirror, Gladiators and The Apprentice? Also, Britain's Got Talent, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up To Cancer and Casualty.
Jimmy Carr, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, as Jon Richardson and Judi Love take on Rob Beckett and Katherine Parkinson. Spencer Jones is in Dictionary Corner.
...Less: Joe Swash and The Batch Lady transform more families' mealtimes. In Yorkshire, can working mum Fiona reduce her food waste and diversify her protein-powered sons' diets?
We meet Brixham's maverick skipper who live-streams his latest catch, and a Cornwall engineer gets a replica of the iconic steam locomotive, The Puffing Devil, back up to full steam.
The potters make body part pots and sculptures of their bodies in motion, fired in brick kilns that they're building themselves. Who can carve out a place in the semi-final?
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
JCB Digger: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Essex to restore a tatty old JCB for carpenter Kev. But rejigging the digger is a bigger job than they figured...
Auburned Out: Mike gambles on a 1935 Auburn car that's been in a barn for two decades. The guys are on shaky ground in Iowa. Dave reveals the results of Mike's biggest investment.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet motocross fan Tom. Henry upcycles Porsche wheel rims into stools. Simon makes an extraordinary lamp from old copper piping.
In a flurry to the finish line, the bespoke bedrooms are completed. And Max drops a dramatic twist ahead of the final that could change everything. (Ep19/20)
Jacqui and Michael have always dreamed of owning an Italian holiday home in a village in Abruzzo's mountains. Craig Rowe shows them what £70k can buy.
Sally and Lee see what treats Tenerife has to offer in Costa Adeje for £450k, from a place that would leave you with a tan like a zebra to a gorgeous Moorish duplex giving paradise vibes.
East London. Fashionista Simran Samra hosts a glitz and glam night and steps out of her vegetarian comfort zone by cooking meat for her guests. (Ep1/5)
East London. Laid-back comedian Yoshki Greenberg aims to throw a relaxing dinner party and surprises her guests with animal-themed pyjama suits for them to wear. (Ep2/5)
East London. City boy Alan Price plans to wow his guests with a medieval-themed feast, but his pig's head table decoration sends vegetarian Simran into a panic. (Ep3/5)
East London. Cordon Bleu cook Delia is confident that she can show her guests how to host a good dinner party. But she has a big row with Alan, and Simran hides under the table... (Ep4/5)
East London. On the final day, doctor Chintu Gademsetty plans a 1980s-themed dinner party. But can he create a cheery atmosphere after the tensions of the past two nights? (Ep5/5)
Paul and Nicola have finally decided to buy a holiday home in the seaside town of Puerto del Carmen on Lanzarote. Ben Hillman shows them five excellent options for their budget of £180,000.
Kirstie and Phil revisit two sets of first-time buyers, Isobel and Chris in the Cotswolds, and student Claire, who had £1.7 million to spend on London's South Bank.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: Kirstie and Phil meet Heather and Tim, whose seven-acre home near Edinburgh has a dysfunctional layout. Tim wants somewhere more rural but Heather wants to stay put.
...Less: Joe Swash and The Batch Lady transform more families' mealtimes. In Yorkshire, can working mum Fiona reduce her food waste and diversify her protein-powered sons' diets?
(2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
In an idyllic Oxfordshire hamlet, the fish in the river keep dying. Why? David Thewlis and Jason Watkins lead in this real-life drama of victims, whistleblowers and water companies. (Ep1)
The drama continues as David Thewlis stars in a real-life story of pollution and criminal convictions that exposes how water companies have polluted our natural resources for so long. (Ep2)
The drama concludes as David Thewlis leads in a real-life story of pollution and criminal convictions that exposes how water companies have polluted our natural resources for so long. (Ep3)
On the beat dealing with Brighton's hectic nightlife as trouble comes thick and fast for the night coppers - from a bunch of youths in a street fight to a knocked-out football fan.
Rose Matafeo joins Joe Lycett for mischief in Malmö. They visit the world's first twisting tower and the Disgusting Food Museum and sample insects and a spirit made from beaver glands.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Toyota MR2: In Cambridgeshire, Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw rescue Kev's Toyota MR2 Mk1, a classic two-seater sports car with more than its fair share of automotive issues.
If You Talk Nice to Me: Mike's on a mission to secure a rare cyclecar that he's coveted for more than two years, but can the guys sweet talk the owner into sealing the deal?

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: In Sussex, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Bill and Annie, who have a penchant for Star Wars collectables and, most importantly - as far as Henry is concerned - motorbikes!
The competition reaches its climax. After weeks of challenges, triumphs and breakthroughs, one pair finally win the keys to their French chateau and the life they've dreamed of. (Ep20/20)
Jasmine Harman helps Caroline and Gary with their dream of owning a Spanish holiday home. What will Valencia province's countryside and villages offer for their £150k?
Karen and David look for a perfect place in Paphos for £360k. Will a stunning stone villa that has David moving in immediately or a place with splendid sea views and a swanky pool deliver?
Bath. Liv Sargeant hosts a sophisticated evening complete with a black-tie dress code, which suits some of her guests more than others. (Ep1/5)
Bath. Ex-raver Mel Lewis-Legèr treats her guests to a night of Cajun food and an old-school rave party, but is her food too hot to handle? (Ep2/5)
Bath. Jon bemused his fellow diners on the previous two nights by dousing his food in ketchup, and now they're convinced that he can't cook. Can his simple grub change their minds? (Ep3/5)
Bath. Café worker Becky sets out to impress with a menu of great British fare. Will her 'Mad Hat' tea party and troop of Morris dancers scoop her the top prize? (Ep4/5)
Bath. Frenchman Denis Verrier plans to give his English guests a lesson in culinary excellence. Will this lead to European union or will cross-Channel relations plummet? (Ep5/5)
Steve and Sid can't wait to buy their own holiday home on Fuerteventura, where they can escape for relaxing getaways with their family. Can Jasmine Harman find their dream place for £100k?
In this revisit edition, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer see whether Rik and Helen found their home in Manchester, and discover if Alison and Phil's big move in Herefordshire worked out.
Steve and Crispin prepare their sheep for a speed shearing competition on Dartmoor. In Looe, everyone gears up for the big one-mile wild swim from St George's Island back to the town beach.
The potters make body part pots and sculptures of their bodies in motion, fired in brick kilns that they're building themselves. Who can carve out a place in the semi-final?
Richard, who's 35, is rushed to Queen's in Nottingham. He collapsed suddenly at home and may be going into organ failure. And Colin's sliced his hand open with a Stanley knife.
On the beat dealing with Brighton's hectic nightlife as trouble comes thick and fast for the night coppers - from a bunch of youths in a street fight to a knocked-out football fan.
The Goggleboxers return for more of the biggest and best TV. What do they think of it this time?
